info.title: SIMaaS Using Queue, Workers and fmpy

get.summary: A list of all available model instances

501.description: The API's response to requests that cannot be answered yet

allOf.description: This schema attempts to formalize the guidelines on how to convey details about problems of HTTP API interactions by means of a _problem detail object_, as defined in [RFC 7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807). The descriptions of the individual members of such objects are copied verbatim from the RFC-document.

type.description: A URI reference ([RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)) that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6), Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

application/problem+json.title: Not Implemented
application/problem+json.detail: The request was understood, but the underlying implementation is not available yet.

post.summary: Instantiate a model for a specific system

parameters.name: modelInstance
parameters.description: A representation of a model instance, used for instantiating a model

allOf.description: The parameter set that defines the model instance
A location on earth expressed as latitude, longitude and elevation

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19
Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

elevation.description: Height above sea level (elevation) in metres

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

allOf.description: The parameters of the model instance representing a specific solar power plant

panelArea.description: Overall surface area of all panels in m2 (combined)

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

panelTilt.description: Surface tilt in degree (Horizonal equals 0°, vertical equals 90°)

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

panelAzimuth.description: Surface azimuth in degree (South equals 0°, positive towards east)

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

T_cell_ref.description: PV cell temperature at reference conditions in K (usually STC)

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19
Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

environmentAlbedo.description: Albedo for isotropic estimation of irradiance by reflection

unit.description: Unit of the value, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

post.summary: Trigger the simulation of a model instance by defining an experiment

parameters.name: experimentSetup
parameters.description: The boundary conditions and simulation parameters that define an experiment

modelInstanceID.description: The UUID of the model instance to be simulated

startTime.description: The beginning of the desired time frame for the simulation in [milliseconds since the UNIX epoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time)

stopTime.description: The end of the desired time frame for the simulation in [milliseconds since the UNIX epoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time)

outputInterval.description: The desired output interval in seconds (does _not_ affect step size of the integration algorithm)

unit.description: Unit of the data, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

timestamp.description: The timestamp (as [unix timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) in ms resolution) of the timeseries to which the value refers to

value.description: The value of the timeseries at the timestamp (unit as specified above)

unit.description: Unit of the data, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

timestamp.description: The timestamp (as [unix timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) in ms resolution) of the timeseries to which the value refers to

value.description: The value of the timeseries at the timestamp (unit as specified above)

timestamp.description: The timestamp (as [unix timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) in ms resolution) of the timeseries to which the value refers to

value.description: The value of the timeseries at the timestamp (unit as specified above)

202.description: An acknowledgement that the simulation was successfully triggered

Location.description: Referral to a resource that indicates the status of the long-running simulation; this resource needs to be polled ([RFC7231, section 7.1.2](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.2))

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a specific experiment

get.summary: A resource indicating the status of an experiment

200.description: The current status of the experiment

status.description: The status of the background job, for example 'IN_PROGRESS'

linkToResult.description: The link to the initially requested resource (the simulation result) that is now available. This property only exists if the status has reached 'DONE' and the result is indeed available.

400.description: The response for requests that were dropped because they were syntactically invalid and failed schema validation

error.description: A serialization of an instance of the [Node.js-class](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v10.x/docs/api/errors.html#errors_errors) `Error`

code.description: A string label for identifying the kind of error

message.description: A description of the specific error instance

stack.description: The stack trace describing the point in the code at which the error occured

ExperimentSetup.name: experimentSetup
ExperimentSetup.description: The boundary conditions and simulation parameters that define an experiment

modelInstanceID.description: The UUID of the model instance to be simulated

startTime.description: The beginning of the desired time frame for the simulation in [milliseconds since the UNIX epoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time)

stopTime.description: The end of the desired time frame for the simulation in [milliseconds since the UNIX epoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time)

outputInterval.description: The desired output interval in seconds (does _not_ affect step size of the integration algorithm)

unit.description: Unit of the data, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

timestamp.description: The timestamp (as [unix timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) in ms resolution) of the timeseries to which the value refers to

value.description: The value of the timeseries at the timestamp (unit as specified above)

ExperimentID.name: uuid
ExperimentID.description: A unique identifier for a specific experiment

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found on this server

allOf.description: This schema attempts to formalize the guidelines on how to convey details about problems of HTTP API interactions by means of a _problem detail object_, as defined in [RFC 7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807). The descriptions of the individual members of such objects are copied verbatim from the RFC-document.

type.description: A URI reference ([RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)) that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6), Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

application/problem+json.title: Not Found
application/problem+json.detail: The requested resource was not found on this server

SchemaValidationFailed.description: The response for requests that were dropped because they were syntactically invalid and failed schema validation

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

application/problem+json.title: Schema Validation Failed
application/problem+json.detail: Request validation failed: Parameter (uuid) does not match required pattern: ^[0-9A-Za-z]{8}-[0-9A-Za-z]{4}-4[0-9A-Za-z]{3}-[89ABab][0-9A-Za-z]{3}-[0-9A-Za-z]{12}$

NotImplemented.description: The API's response to requests that cannot be answered yet

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

application/problem+json.detail: The request was understood, but the underlying implementation is not available yet.

ExperimentStatus.description: The current status of the experiment

status.description: The status of the background job, for example 'IN_PROGRESS'

linkToResult.description: The link to the initially requested resource (the simulation result) that is now available. This property only exists if the status has reached 'DONE' and the result is indeed available.

unit.description: Unit of the data, formatted as defined in the [Modelica Specification v3.4](https://www.modelica.org/documents/ModelicaSpec34.pdf), Chapter 19

timestamp.description: The timestamp (as [unix timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) in ms resolution) of the timeseries to which the value refers to

value.description: The value of the timeseries at the timestamp (unit as specified above)

tags.name: Model Instances
tags.description: A model instance is the executable version of a model with all parameters set, thus describing the behaviour of a specific system for all possible boundary conditions. The parameters of a model instance cannot be changed in order to ensure that identical service interactions always lead to the same result. Consequently, it is possible that different model instances describe the same specific system, which can be a result of different parameter sets or the use of different models.

tags.name: Experiments
tags.description: An experiment denotes the execution of a model instance for given boundary conditions and simulation settings; in other words, a specific simulation.

tags.name: Unsuccessful Operations
tags.description: Paths/operations using this tag only exist for demonstrating the API's responses to malformed requests.
